column4: does ubuntu server install disk support raid or do i have to use the alternate text only install?
I beleive that server and alt cd both have the raid stuff on them
i think you helped me earlier with the grub problem?
I may have, what is your current issue ?
system wont boot :)
with the super grub cd right ?
i tried it, i must be stupid cause it was confusing...
how old is this install of ubuntu on your comp ?
brand new on the one im having issues with
i have a ide drive as storage, it says its hdc, then i have 2 sata drives
just clean install it , it will be easier,  the grub issue will take care of itself
i dont think it will, it was a fresh install, and it didnt work
my recommendation is that you change the boot hdd in the bios to the hdd you will install ubuntu on before you install ubuntu
it was set to sata, which is where i installed ubuntu
unplug the storage hdd before proceeding you can add it to grub after ward
i was going to reinstall without the ide drive hooked up, then hook it up later, am stil afaid it will mess up when i do hook it up
it shouldn'T not as long as it is not set as the boot hdd
? if its a storage drive, i wouldnt add it to grub ?
well my thought was the bios treats the ide's as the first drives and the sata after that, even though i tell it to boot sata first
grub should only list  OS not drives

leave the storage hdd in then, put it as boot hdd, in the bios and let phase one of grub install to it , that will solve the problem but you won't be able to boot fi you remove the storage hdd afterward
yeah, i understand that
